bi_etl.components.data_analyzer module¶

Created on Oct 9, 2015

@author: woodd

class bi_etl.components.data_analyzer.DataAnalyzer(task=None, logical_name='DataAnalyzer', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: bi_etl.components.etlcomponent.ETLComponent

Class that analyzes the data rows passed to it. * Tracks distinct columns passed in * Tracks datatype of each column * Tracks valid values of each column

Parameters:
  • task (ETLTask) – The instance to register in (if not None)
  • logical_name (str) – The logical name of this source. Used for log messages.
DEFAULT_FORMAT = '{col:30} type = {type:20} non_null_rows={non_null_rows:15,} cardinality={cardinality:15,}{msg}'¶
class DataType(name, length=None, precision=None, fmt=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

DataAnalyzer.PIPE_FORMAT = '{col}|{type}|{present}|{not_present_on_rows}|{non_null_rows}|{cardinality}|{most_common_value}|{msg}'¶
DataAnalyzer.analyze_column(column_name, column_value, column_number=None)[source]¶
DataAnalyzer.analyze_row(row)[source]¶

Analyze the data row passed in. Call this for all the rows that should be analyzed.

DataAnalyzer.close()[source]¶
DataAnalyzer.next_row()[source]¶
DataAnalyzer.print_analysis(out=None, valid_value_limit=10, out_fmt='{col:30} type = {type:20} non_null_rows={non_null_rows:15, } cardinality={cardinality:15, }{msg}')[source]¶

Print the data analyzis results.

Parameters:
  • out (File) – The File to write the results to. Default=``stdout``
  • valid_value_limit (int) – How many valid values should be printed.
